Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: NEW KINGDOM (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Name: Cup
Description: Cup mounted on a curved foot. The body flares out diagonally and ends in a tapered lip, in continuation of the former. This object was probably manufactured in Upper Egypt. It was wheel-made from a very pure white calcareous clay which has been polished.
